intro: Anthemis cota, commonly known as golden buttons, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellow-orange ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, giving it a daisy-like appearance. Anthemis cota typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its bright, cheerful blooms.
